result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermain R Palmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count four and with any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS THREE AND FOUR:  Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  To be paid by end of probation period.   Any remaining balance to convert to civil jdugment.
Obtain/maintain full time employment,  or full time school with part time employment.

Provide DNA sample if not previously done so, pay surcharge.
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms; and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users, dealers, houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Partcipate in cognitive thinking.
Pay all supervision fees.
Restitution set at zero.
Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary complete follow up care/treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until 11/14/14 at 3:00 p.m.  Release for employment.  No good time.  No electronic monitoring. The Court has no objection to time being served in the State of IL if accepted.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to count three and with any other  senence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermain R Palmer

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment on June 30, 2017.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Filed: 7 letters submitted on behalf of the defendant.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/21/2014-LJ

Defendant Jermain R Palmer in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing on today.  Defense request for adjournment heard and granted by the Court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jermain R Palmer in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 21.
Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed, but read in for the purposes of sentencing.  As to Counts 3 & 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant appears in court.  Defendant advised that his attorney is unavailable on today.  Defendant provided next court date slip in open court.  Case adjourned to 8-26-14 at 8:30 a.m. for Plea Hearing before Branch 21.

with Attorney Mark Pecora's office and ADA Lucy Konforst.  Attorney Pecora unable to attend hearing set for 7-31-14 due to attendance at a funeral.  Matter to be rescheduled upon the appearance of the defendant.

Defendant Jermain R Palmer in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.  

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jermain R Palmer in court with Attorney Mark Pecora.  Jesica Ballenger for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
  
Matter before the court for Scheduling conference.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.

Defendant Jermain R Palmer in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.

Defendant Jermain R Palmer in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/23/14 @ 1:30 pm
